Named Entity Recognition

TEI Publisher includes support for detecting and tagging named entities in texts. The idea is to further simplify the work of editors when annotating documents via TEI Publisherâ€™s web-based annotation editor by automatically identifying potential candidates for people, places etc.

For named entity recognition to be available in the web-based annotation editor, a separate Python service is needed: clone the tei-publisher-ner repository and follow the instructions in the README.

The presentation below has been realised with an earlier version of the TEI Publisher, nevertheless everything works the same, the only difference being the position of the NER icon in the toolbar.

One of the distinguishing features of this solution is that it makes it rather easy to train a recognition model on your own data sets. Head over to the article on e-editiones to read more about the service, how to use it, and how to train it.
